pullRequest.body:
From the sphere eversion project.

In passing, we rename variables in one more lemma and use fun_prop in a tiny way.

-------------

- [x] depends on: #11131
- [x] depends on: #11137
- [x] depends on: #11139
- [x] depends on: #11160

nodes.body: Could you please extract a separate mini-PR removing the style exceptions for already-fixed overlong files? (I think two of these are my fault, sorry!)

On the topic of overlong files: we definitely don't want to add new style exceptions if we can help it. I wonder if it might make sense to have a new file called something like `DominatedConvergence.lean`, which could contain all the material currently in `Bochner.lean` that relies on dominated convergence, together with the new lemmas about set integrals from this PR. That would avoid making `SetIntegral` overlong, and would also be a step in the right direction for `Bochner.lean`.
@loefflerd Filed #11137 for the style exceptions.

On overlong files: makes sense; I'll try to create such a file.
Should I also include the section in `IntervalIntegral` (see #11110)? I have the same problem in that file.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11131~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11137~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11139~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#11160~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Some more comments:
- Something's fishy with the variable declarations at line 1375: you have `X` and `Y` declared twice (not actually harmful, but messy).
- `F` is a normed space in the variable declarations, but a function in `continuous_parametric_integral_of_continuous`; please use lowercase `f`
- I found some other places one can use `fun_prop` and `filter_upwards` in your proof:
````lean
/-- The parametric integral over a continuous function on a compact set is continuous,
  under mild assumptions on the topologies involved. -/
theorem continuous_parametric_integral_of_continuous
    [FirstCountableTopology X] [LocallyCompactSpace X]
    [OpensMeasurableSpace Y] [SecondCountableTopologyEither Y E] [IsLocallyFiniteMeasure Î¼]
    {f : X â†’ Y â†’ E} (hf : Continuous f.uncurry) {s : Set Y} (hs : IsCompact s) :
    Continuous (âˆ« y in s, f Â· y âˆ‚Î¼) := by
  rw [continuous_iff_continuousAt]
  intro xâ‚€
  rcases exists_compact_mem_nhds xâ‚€ with âŸ¨U, U_cpct, U_nhdsâŸ©
  rcases (U_cpct.prod hs).bddAbove_image hf.norm.continuousOn with âŸ¨M, hMâŸ©
  apply continuousAt_of_dominated
  Â· filter_upwards with x using Continuous.aestronglyMeasurable (by fun_prop)
  Â· filter_upwards [U_nhds] with x x_in
    rw [ae_restrict_iff]
    Â· filter_upwards with t t_in using hM (mem_image_of_mem _ <| mk_mem_prod x_in t_in)
    Â· exact (isClosed_le (by fun_prop) (by fun_prop)).measurableSet
  Â· exact integrableOn_const.mpr (Or.inr hs.measure_lt_top)
  Â· filter_upwards using (by fun_prop)
````
(Interestingly, if one deletes "with x" at the first `filter_upwards` call, the Lean server crashes!)
- Not related to this patch, but close by: is it deliberate that the statement of `continuousOn_integral_bilinear_of_locally_integrable_of_compact_support` requires both `[NormedSpace ð•œ E]` and `[NormedSpace â„ E]` at the same time, without requiring any kind of compatibility between `ð•œ` and `â„`? This feels strange to me. It looks like you never actually use the fact that there's a `ð•œ`-linear structure; you just need to know that `L` is Lipschitz in both variables. (But maybe we don't have the API to state that in its natural degree of generality.)

Thank you for the careful observations! Those are nice golfs, I've learned quite a bit :-) I have addressed your comments.

Your last question is a good one. Indeed, the lemma currently uses both the \R-linear and the \k-linear structure.
It is possible to phrase everything over \R; I've pushed that as a temporary commit (`5bf1f17`) for you to see. To be honest, I'm not sure what the original intention was: perhaps the author wanted to generalise to others fields where easily possible?

I just realised that I had misunderstood: I thought `continuousOn_integral_bilinear_of_locally_integrable_of_compact_support` had been added by you, but I see now this was incorrect, it was Sebastian GouÃ«zel in #8247. So it is clearly irrelevant to the present PR.

I think brutally enforcing `ð•œ = â„` in `continuousOn_integral_bilinear_of_locally_integrable_of_compact_support ` is probably a very bad idea, because the case of complex coefficients is probably needed too. Let's just ignore it and not go looking for trouble ðŸ˜„

This looks good to me. 

(Note to maintainers: the issue discussed above about two `NormedSpace` declarations in continuousOn_integral_bilinear_of_locally_integrable_of_compact_support has been queried with Sebastian on zulip, and he says it's intentional; but in any case it is orthogonal to the changes made in this PR.)

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.
Thank you for the thorough review!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8201212842/job/22429475178)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8201212842/job/22429474339)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8201212842/job/22429474963)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
  rcases (U_cpct.prod hs).bddAbove_image hF.norm.continuousOn with âŸ¨M, hMâŸ©
```
Why change Î± but not Î²? (Might be better in a separate PR anyway)

Because `X` occurs in the following lemma :-)
I've renamed all `Î±` in this file, filed as #11131.

```suggestion
    Continuous fun x â†¦ âˆ« y in s, F x y âˆ‚Î¼ := by
```
or maybe even
```suggestion
    Continuous (âˆ« y in s, F Â· y âˆ‚Î¼) := by
Well, can it? ðŸ˜„ If not, since `fun_prop` is under active development right now, it might be worth posting this example on Zulip.
Turns out it works :tada:
Just wondering: can any of this be streamlined with the `filter_upwards` tactic?

Thanks for asking! I managed to use it thrice (in the last commit). I'm not sure if all of these are better or if the "using" lines should rather be separate exact statements. Let me know if you prefer a different style!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: continuity of the parametric set integral

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: move material about the Dominated Convergence Theorem into one file
[Merged by Bors] - chore(Integral/SetIntegral): various small clean-ups
